courses.title: AI Internship Preparation Bootcamp
courses.description: A four-week hybrid program that equips final-year computer-science students with practical skills in modern NLP, large language models, and MLOps, culminating in a guaranteed two-month paid internship at partner companies.
courses.instructorBio: PhD in Machine Learning, 8 years industry R&D (Google, DeepMind), author of two papers on efficient LLM fine-tuning.
learningOutcomes: Apply prompt-engineering patterns for business tasks
Containerise and deploy an LLM micro-service
Collaborate with Git, CI/CD, and code reviews

lessons.title: Modern ML Foundations
lessons.description: Python & NumPy refresher, automatic differentiation, and the anatomy of a transformer block.
lessons.content:
Week 1 – Foundations

This module reviews essential math and coding skills, introduces GPU tooling, and walks through every sub-layer in a transformer encoder.

attachments.name: Week 1 Slides
attachments.description: Deck covering key concepts and formulas.

questions.question: Which operation enables backpropagation in PyTorch?
questions.explanation: torch.autograd tracks operations and computes gradients automatically.

lessons.title: NLP Essentials & Fine-Tuning
lessons.description: Data preprocessing, embeddings, and fine-tuning DistilBERT on a sentiment dataset.
lessons.content:
Week 2 – NLP & Fine-Tuning

Hands-on walkthrough of tokenisation pipelines and Hugging Face Trainer for multi-lingual sentiment analysis.

questions.question: What is the main benefit of using pretrained embeddings?
options: They provide contextual meaning from large corpora
They eliminate the need for tokenisation
questions.explanation: Pretrained embeddings encode semantic information learned from vast text data.

lessons.title: Generative AI for Business
lessons.description: Prompt engineering patterns, RAG pipeline construction, and safety guardrails.
lessons.content:
Week 3 – Generative AI

Students build a retrieval-augmented FAQ chatbot and implement basic red-teaming tests.

questions.question: Which component injects external knowledge into an LLM in a RAG system?
questions.explanation: The vector store retrieves relevant chunks that are merged with the prompt.

lessons.title: Capstone & MLOps Lite
lessons.description: FastAPI + LangChain deployment, Docker packaging, monitoring, and interview preparation.
lessons.content:
Week 4 – Capstone

Teams ship a micro-service that summarises long documents and expose it via REST. Session concludes with demo day and mock technical interviews.

attachments.name: FastAPI Template Repo
attachments.description: Starter code for the deployment task.

questions.question: Which file defines Docker build instructions?
questions.explanation: A Dockerfile contains directives to build an image.
